content: this legal case involves a dispute over the division of joint assets between two parties identified as v f and js the harju county court in tallinn estonia made a decision on 3072019 after the case had been ongoing for 3 years and 6 months the court granted sole ownership of an apartment to v f without the need to compensate js js is required to provide a declaration of intent to transfer ownership of their share of the apartment the real estate department at the tartu county court has made changes to the property registration the court also ordered js to bear the costs of the proceedings the decision will be publicly published and considered delivered 15 days after publication either party has 30 days to appeal the decision to the tallinn district court procedural assistance may be provided if needed the claimants claim is based on the dissolution of their marriage and the division of joint assets including the apartment the court found it possible to deviate from equal shares and granted sole ownership of the apartment to the claimant the court considered relevant laws and previous decisions in making its evaluation the court determined that the apartment was acquired by the claimant before the marriage ended and without the need to compensate the defendant the court also awarded the claimant reimbursement for expenses related to the joint assets the court updated the land registry to reflect the claimant as the sole owner of the apartment procedural costs were reserved for each party the decision was publicly delivered to the defendant
